English (United States)(en-US): I handed you a knife.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 네게 칼자루를 들려줬어.

English (United States)(en-US): A knife with a sharpened blade\nmore than ready for blood.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잔인하리만치 퍼렇게 날이\n서 있는 칼의 칼자루를.

English (United States)(en-US): Your every move would\nbecome a cut in my body.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너의 휘두르는 몸짓은 낱낱이\n나의 생채기가 되겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): Knife?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 칼이라니?

English (United States)(en-US): You’ve never handed me a knife.|There’s no way I’d hurt you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치가 준 칼을 가진 적은 없는걸.|내가 널 다치게 할 리 없잖아.

English (United States)(en-US): The knife can’t be seen and has\nmany names—and you do have it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 칼은 보이지 않는데다 이름도\n여러 개지만, 넌 이미 갖고 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): Are you sure?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 확신할 수 있겠어?

English (United States)(en-US): Humans usually call\nthat knife affection.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간들은 대개 그 칼을\n애정이라고 부르거든.

English (United States)(en-US): Ah. Hm.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, 으음.

English (United States)(en-US): So you’re saying… that the affection\nyou gave me is like a knife?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니까 뭉치 네 말은… 네가\n내게 준 애정이 칼과 같다는 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): And that I’ll cut you with it?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래서 널 상처 입힐 거라고?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래.

English (United States)(en-US): I’ve had similar thoughts.|What led you to think this?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나도 비슷한 생각을 해 본 적 있어.|왜 그런 생각을 하게 됐어?

English (United States)(en-US): I’ve realized wounds caused by those you\nfeel affection for hurts twice, thrice as much.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 소중하게 생각하는 대상에게 받는\n상처가 배로 아프다는 걸 느꼈거든.

English (United States)(en-US): Yes. So much so that it feels\nimpossible to come back from.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응. 어쩌면 회복 불가능할 정도로.

English (United States)(en-US): To have affection for someone is to\nbe defenseless in their presence.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 애정을 갖는다는 건, 그 앞에서만은\n무방비해질 수 있다는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s a resolve to let down my guard,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가 가진 방패를 내려 놓고,

English (United States)(en-US): and expose my delicate underbelly.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 연약한 부분을 뒤집어 보여 줄 수 있다는 각오지.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s also like handing someone\nthe most powerful weapon.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 반대로 상대에게 가장 강력한 무기를 쥐어 주는 것과 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): So I… I…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래서 난… 나는…

English (United States)(en-US): Are you afraid?|Do you regret it?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 두려워?|후회해?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes. I am afraid.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 맞아. 두려워.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s not regret. But… I’m afraid.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 후회와는 달라. 하지만… 두려워.

English (United States)(en-US): All of a sudden, I’m afraid.\nTo have affection.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 문득 두려워졌어.\n애정의 마음을 갖는 일이.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, ever thought about running\ninto the terrifyingly beautiful sea?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 두려울 만큼 아름다운\n바다에 뛰어들고 싶었던 적이 있어?

English (United States)(en-US): Yeah, I have.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응. 있어.|아니. 없어.

English (United States)(en-US): Even though you know the\nwaves will swallow you whole?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 파도가 너를 집어 삼킬 걸 알면서도?

English (United States)(en-US): Sometimes, yes.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 가끔은 그래.

English (United States)(en-US): … I guess we all want to jump into\nthe dazzling abyss from time to time.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): … 누구나 종종 눈부신 심연\n속에 뛰어들기를 원하지.

English (United States)(en-US): Into something that would\nembrace us fiercely.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나를 끈적하게 휘감을 무언가.

English (United States)(en-US): Embrace us, but then shatter us into sand.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 마주 안고, 끝내 모래알처럼\n흩어지게 할 무언가에 말이야.

English (United States)(en-US): Do you think the sea would\ntake me… Even as I am?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이렇게 작고 새까만 나도\n바다에 안길 수 있을까?

English (United States)(en-US): I see that impulse has yet to\nfind you. That is a misfortune.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런 강렬한 마음이 아직 너에게 찾아간 적이\n없다니. 그건 소소한 불행이야, <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): Such a crescendo of the mind is hard\nto come by. I want to experience it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 마음이 치닫는 것은 쉽게 오지 않는\n기회거든. 나는 그런 기회를 누리고 싶어.

English (United States)(en-US): The urge to throw myself headfirst into\nwhat would shatter me into sand.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 눈부시지만, 나를 끝내 모래알처럼\n흩어지게 할 무언가에 뛰어들고 싶다는 것.

English (United States)(en-US): Do you think the sea would\ntake me… Even as I am?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이렇게 작고 새까만 나도\n바다에 안길 수 있을까?

English (United States)(en-US): I would think so. The sea\ndoesn’t discriminate.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아마 그럴 거야. 바다의\n품은 아주 넓으니까.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, I could just soar\nacross an entire ocean!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 바다로 날아갈\n수도 있을 듯한 기분이야!

English (United States)(en-US): If a sweet smelling candy basket or\nthe nightmare of an extinct creature
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나를 흩어지게 하는 게 달콤한\n향이 나는 사탕 바구니나

English (United States)(en-US): were to scatter me I wouldn’t\nbe nearly as joyful!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 멸종된 동물의 악몽이었다면\n이렇게 기쁘지는 않았을 거야!

English (United States)(en-US): The sea would tenderly carry me away,\nthen rip me apart without hesitation.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 파도에 휩쓸리면 바다는 나를 부드럽게 안고, 강렬하게 찢어 발기겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): To relish such beauty — perhaps\nthat’s what I want, deep down…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 거대한 아름다움을 만끽하는 것—\n그건 내가 진정으로 바라던 것일지 몰라.

English (United States)(en-US): (Talk Dot down)|(Let Dot go on.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치를 말린다.|생각을 이어가도록 둔다.

English (United States)(en-US): But Dot, the road seems dangerous.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 뭉치, 그 길은 위험해보여.

English (United States)(en-US): You’re right. It won’t be\neasy. I’d have to leave you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래 맞아. 쉽지만은 않은 일이야.\n그러려면 널 떠나야 하니까.

English (United States)(en-US): And say goodbye to my silent\nbut kind companion, the mold
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 과묵하지만 따뜻한 친구였던 빵 곰팡이와

English (United States)(en-US): as well as its many spores scattered\nhere there and everywhere.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 제멋대로 흩어진 그의\n포자들에게도 작별을 해야 하지.

English (United States)(en-US): Yes. Perhaps it will be an\nunforgettable experience.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래. 어쩌면 잊지 못할\n경험이 될 수도 있겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): But then I’d have to leave you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): …. 하지만 그러려면 널 떠나야 할 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): And say goodbye to my silent\nbut kind companion, the mold,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 과묵하지만 따뜻한 친구였던 빵 곰팡이와

English (United States)(en-US): as well as its many spores scattered\nhere there and everywhere.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 제멋대로 흩어진 그의\n포자들에게도 작별을 해야 하지.

English (United States)(en-US): (Feel relieved.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (조심스럽게 안심한다.)

English (United States)(en-US): Besides, I’ve yet to become a dream…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무엇보다 아직 꿈이 되지 못했으니…

English (United States)(en-US): When I become one, I think I’d be quite\ncontent to run into the sea’s arms.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꿈이 되고 나서는, 마음껏 바다의 품에\n안길 수 있을 것 같다는 생각이 들어.

English (United States)(en-US): I’ll be a dream, dreaming\none never-ending dream.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 끝없이 파도치는 꿈이 될 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): I’ll close my eyes and soon I’ll\nbe floating - up, up, and away.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 눈을 감고… 두둥실 떠오르겠지. 그때의\n나는 분명 바다를 닮아 있을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): I spent all day watching Tim Burton’s\n“The Night Before Christmas” yesterday!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, <nickname>. 어제 하루 종일 팀\n버튼의 <크리스마스의 악몽>을 봤어!

English (United States)(en-US): I didn’t dare breathe, I didn’t dare blink,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 한 숨도 쉬지 않고, 눈을 최대한\n적게 깜빡이려 노력하며

English (United States)(en-US): and I watched, and watched, and watched.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 계속, 계속, 계속 봤어.

English (United States)(en-US): Until the black screen signaled the end.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 모든 것이 끝났다는\n검은 화면이 뜰 때까지.

English (United States)(en-US): My, it’s stunning. It’s intense!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 세상에, 멋있어. 강렬해!

English (United States)(en-US): I never knew black could be so cool.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 세상엔 폼 나는 검정도\n있다는 걸 배웠어.

English (United States)(en-US): But.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런데.

English (United States)(en-US): Why… why is my black like this, <nickname>?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나의 검정은 왜…. 왜 이럴까, <nickname>?

English (United States)(en-US): It’s ugly.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 볼품없어.

English (United States)(en-US): … It’s ugly.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): … 볼품없어.

English (United States)(en-US): “Being with people who don’t\nlisten is lonelier than being alone.”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “듣지 않는 상대와 함께 있는 건\n혼자일 때보다 더 외로운 일이다.”

English (United States)(en-US): Isn’t that wonderfully profound?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 놀랍도록 철학적이지 않아?

English (United States)(en-US): Okay, well, you don’t have\nto like it because I like it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래, 뭐, 꼭 내가 좋아한다고\n좋아할 필요는 없어.

English (United States)(en-US): Being with people who don’t listen\nis lonelier than being alone, isn’t it?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 듣지 않는 상대와 함께 있는 건 혼자일\n때보다 외로운 게 확실해, 그렇지?

English (United States)(en-US): Fine, I’ve only ever talked to\n<nickname>, so I don’t really know.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래, 오직 <nickname> 한 명과\n이야기를 나눠 본 난 확답을 줄 수 없겠지만.

English (United States)(en-US): But it must be. Lonely, I mean.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇지만 분명 그럴\n거야. 외로울 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): When I’m alone, I let my mind wander.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 혼자 있을 때면 난 마음을 풀어\n헤치고 상상 속을 거닐어.

English (United States)(en-US): I travel to foreign planets\nwhere it rains glitter,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 비 대신 반짝이가 내리는 낯선\n행성으로 여행을 떠나기도 하고,

English (United States)(en-US): chat with anglerfish in the deep dark ocean, and live as a little girl in the 1880s.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 심해 아귀와의 깜깜한 담소를 즐기기도 하고,\n1880년대의 어린 소녀가 되어 보기도 해.

English (United States)(en-US): And when I’m with <nickname>, they listen.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 <nickname>과 함께일 때면,\n<nickname>만은 내 말을 들어줘.

English (United States)(en-US): They listen to my musings,\nquestions, and confessions, all of it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내 사색, 질문, 고해, 그 모든 걸.

English (United States)(en-US): But to be with someone who doesn’t listen?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇지만 듣지 않는 상대는 어떨까?

English (United States)(en-US): It must feel as if you’re talking to a wall,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 꼭 벽이랑 대화하는 기분일 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): or a gust of wind passing by.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니면 스치는 바람과 대화하는 기분.

English (United States)(en-US): It must feel as if you are locked in a\nglass box in the middle of a busy city,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 바쁜 도시 한가운데 유리 상자\n속 갇혀있는 기분일 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): where you’re screaming and\nscreaming but no one ever hears you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 날카롭고 간절하게 소리치며 벽을 긁어\n보지만, 아무도 내 비명을 듣지 못하는.

English (United States)(en-US): I would never do that to you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 절대 너를 외롭게 두지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): You know that, right?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 알고 있지?

English (United States)(en-US): I’m always ready to listen.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 난 언제나 들을 준비가\n되어 있으니까.

English (United States)(en-US): I’ll be right here, waiting.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 여기서 기다리고 있을게.

English (United States)(en-US): Even if the only sound you make is the\nsound of your spores, fluttering mid-air.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네가 포자 흩뿌리는 소리밖에 못\n낼지라도. 나는 듣고 있을 거야.
